docs.text: finding the courage to face life full-on is a difficult task .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: summoning up the audacity to fall in love is a harder job .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if you're a total jerk like melvin udall is , the odds are even more against you .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: melvin ( jack nicholson ) is a successful romance author who is just the opposite of what you would expect someone in that profession to be .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a solitary man hidden away in his new york apartment with no human interaction and not even a hint of ever having been in a passionate relationship , he avoids the outside world as much as possible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his obsessive-compulsive disorder rules his life as he uses several different bars of soap to wash his hands and refuses to step on a crack on the sidewalk .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( there's a great scene when he has to cross a floor made of mosaic tiles -- _very_small_ mosaic tiles . )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: melvin has some great lines .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when his publisher's receptionist asks him how he writes women so well in his books , he responds " i think of men and i take away reason and accountability . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: don't get him wrong , he's not merely a misogynist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: setting his sights higher than that , he's also a homophobe , racist , anti-semite , xenophobe , animal-hater and intensely dislikes people who talk in metaphors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when we first meet him , he's busy dumping a neighbor's dog down the garbage chute .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's an equal opportunity bigot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he does venture outside his apartment every day to eat breakfast at a local cafe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: melvin is such a grouchy curmudgeon that waitress carol connelly ( helen hunt ) is the only one willing to wait on him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and she's none too happy about it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when carol doesn't show up for work , melvin's routine is shot and he's determined to do something about it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tracking down her address , he shows up at her place begging her to come back to work so that he can eat breakfast .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fact that she's a poor single mother caring for a chronically ill son doesn't appear to phase him , he wants his food .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: much more upsetting is that his gay artist neighbor simon bishop ( greg kinnear ) is brutally attacked during a robbery .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this doesn't upset melvin much ( " don't worry , you'll be back on your knees in no time " ) but when he is bullied into taking care of simon's dog , his life is turned topsy-turvey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: melvin is sequestered because he's afraid of what's out there on the other side of his apartment door .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he has to make sure it's ritualistically locked three times to keep the world on its proper side .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he brings the dog home he reluctantly grows fond of it , talking to it and taking it everywhere he goes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this little crack in his emotional armor opens him up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hiding behind his need for carol to return to work so she can serve him , he pays for a specialist to treat her son .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he even develops a friendship with simon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all three people are heavily damaged .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: melvin has retreated from life in his apartment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: carol has devoted herself to her son , convinced that she has to give up her life for him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: simon is estranged from his parents and his friends disappear when he is hospitalized and his money runs out .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a more unlikely trio to form relationships , you'd rarely see .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and in the midst of it all , there are some wonderful moments .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: melvin is hilarious in his grouchiness and touching as he attempts to be nice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " you make me want to be a better man , " he tells her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the best aspects is that even as he opens up , he is still a curmudgeon .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: carol , afraid that his monetary contribution to the wellness of her son hides a hidden agenda rushes over to his apartment in the rain to explain in no uncertain terms that she will never sleep with him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it only takes her a second to realize that she is delivering that statement while looking as if she just left a wet t-shirt contest .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's hardly anything left to say about jack nicholson .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i don't remember ever seeing him in anything less than a stellar performance and his over-the-edge melvin is no disappointment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nicholson may be the best actor working today .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hunt does a commendable job matching nicholson's energy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: she isn't afraid to be seen as something less than a babe and her portrayal of exhausted run-down carol struggling with seemingly overwhelming obligations is top-notch .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: their on-screen chemistry is a bit odd .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: each does a wonderful job with the character , but together , there's something a little off .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a minor problem : they do work well together , but that missing element is what prevents this from being a four-star film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director james l . brooks ( " terms of endearment " , " broadcast news " ) has a movie that is picking up awards by the bucketsful ( nominees for all the top golden globes , winners from the national board of review , inevitable oscars ) and has a winner on his hands .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " as good as it gets " isn't exactly the quality that the title says , but it's pretty darn close .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( michael redman has written this column for over 22 years and as soon as he finishes this one , he's off to an annual 12 night celebration typically held in freezing weather during a snowstorm .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this year it's in the sixties and raining .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that wacky el nino . )
docs.label: positive
